txt.en: You escape from the fortress and look for your companions
Listen to what Tatháta has to say
Listen to what Tatháta has to say
Talk to Rahâzi
'Before the death of Tumúldo Fierce-water, she wanted Umbar to be free.'
Sneak into the fortress and search the right side of the Ordâkhai camp
'I think that is no longer enough for her.'
'Now she listens only to Azagath's promise of a mighty weapon to destroy Gondor.'
'He named it The Song of Waves and Wind, but whatever it might be, it is not yet ready.'
Rahâzi wants to go over the plan before you infiltrate the fortress above Jirush.
'He can delay her impatience for only so long, I think.'
'If he cannot produce this mighty weapon soon, Nakási's loyalty may be tested.'
Your part of the plan requires you to sneak inside the fortress turn to the right to search for the prisoner.
'I would not wager on the victor of that contest, [placeholder].'

'Listen closely to the plan.

'I will make for the buildings opposite the entrance, and move from shadow to shadow. Corudan and Sigileth will pass through the main gate and search for their quarry on the left side of the fortress. And you will look search for him on the right side, [placeholder]. I will give you some minutes before engaging the enemy... but you will not have very long!

'In days to come, may the Ordâkhai speak in hushed tones of our work tonight! Fortune smile upon us!'
Tatháta has come to the fortress above Jirush.
You have come with Rahâzi, Corudan, and Sigileth to the fortress above Jirush with the hope that you will be able to find Balakhâd and free him from Ordâkhai captivity.
Tatháta has come to the fortress above Jirush.

'I have spent weeks hunting agents of the Heirsworn who seek to claim the bounties placed upon the Kindred of the Coins by the widow Saklaphêl. Agents such as you, [placeholder].'\n\nYou deny that you are in Saklaphêl's employ. Tatháta eyes you closely.
Tatháta has come to the fortress above Jirush.

'You have had ample time to act upon the widow's orders, if you sought her bounty upon us. Have I not espied you from afar in the company of Kinsman Belondor, his back turned to you at length and without fear? And when I decided on that moonlit night mere days ago to put an end to both these questions and your life, was it not the arrival of Khôltekh and Rothog that stayed my attack? I am not often surprised, [placeholder], but on that night your friendship with my allies was a startlement to me. No servant of Saklaphêl could deceive such as they for long.

'Why do you ally with the Kindred? Are we not enemies?'

You briefly describe your shared fear that Azagath and Nakási are using a map they took from the Mâkhda Khorbo to search for a buried evil of Sauron's somewhere east of Umbar. Tatháta nods slowly.
'You are bold to ask this of me, [placeholder]!'
Tatháta has offered to answer a single question of yours.
'I was born with another name, in another land.'
Tatháta has agreed to answer a single question of yours.
'They drove me out, and I wandered in the wild for years.'
'Saklaphêl's bounty hunter?'
'From the Long Lake to the Sea of Rhûn I voyaged, honing my skills as a mariner.'
'She chose her target without care, [placeholder], and perished for it.'
Tatháta has answered your question, and the sound of distant shouting has brought your conversation with her to a close.
'When at last I came to Ethir Anduin I was confronted by a raiding band of Corsairs.'
'The sands have run from the hourglass, [placeholder], and our conversation is ended. I am pleased I did not slay you. Your answers were most informative.\n\n'Good-bye.'
'The hunter must always be prepared for the prey to prove more deadly than she.'
'They thought to take me captive.'
'That is the way of things in the wild.'
TBD - Blah!
'Instead I became their captain.'
'Make not her mistake: these lands are wild.'
'To forget that is to die.'
Distant shouting disturbs the fortress. Rahâzi's task is accomplished
'I want to talk to you, [placeholder].'
'I have ensured we will not be disturbed.'
'He is not still held captive by the Kindred?'
'This way.'
'That must please the dwarf.'
'I was prepared to slay you when you strayed beyond the ancient wall, [placeholder].'
'Khôltekh and Hármelak argued about what to do with the son of the Scourge.'
'But something stayed my hand.'
'Balakhôr was always a problem. It seems his son remains so.'
'It was curiosity.'
'The Sea-shadow has always had a fascination with that land, and with artifacts of Sauron.'
'Until he is slain, the Kindred must fear the return of the Heirs of Castamir.'
'You are more free with your answers than I expected.'
'Months ago he sent Khôltekh to a fortress of evil in the distant north.'
A number of Ordâkhai soldiers have already been slain. What transpired here?
'And yet Gondor must fear it too.'
'But you have satisfied my curiosity.'
'When the dwarf returned, he delivered something to Azagath.'
The time has come for you to leave the fortress before you are discovered by the Ordâkhai.
Tatháta watches you carefully
'The question, I think, is who must fear it more?'
'You have earned an answer of your own.'
'I know not what it was, but it could be held in one hand and exuded an aura of dread.'
'And yet if Azagath served Mordor, he hid it well.'
'He bore no love for the Church of the All-seeing, and has slain its agents by the score.'
'So has every member of the Kindred.'
'I will answer a single question. Choose your inquiry with care.'
'Ask me a single question and I will answer it.'
'One question ONLY, [placeholder].'
Remain on your guard and listen to the newcomer
Talk to Tatháta
Talk to Tatháta
Ask Tatháta a single question
Listen to what Tatháta has to say
Talk to Tatháta
Leave the fortress by the main gate before you are discovered by the Ordâkhai
'Now we must search separately!'
Instance: Shadows In Jirush
